item.title: DuckDuckGo beefs up scam defense to block fake stores, crypto sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The DuckDuckGo web browser has expanded its built-in Scam Blocker tool to protect against a broader range of online scams, including fake e-commerce, cryptocurrency exchanges, and "scareware" sites. [...]

item.title: Telecom giant Viasat breached by China's Salt Typhoon hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Satellite communications company Viasat is the latest victim of China's Salt Typhoon cyber-espionage group, which has previously hacked into the networks of multiple other telecom providers in the United States and worldwide. [...]

item.title: Krispy Kreme says November data breach impacts over 160,000 people
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: U.S. doughnut chain Krispy Kreme confirmed that attackers stole the personal information of over 160,000 individuals in a November 2024 cyberattack. [...]

item.title: Ryuk ransomware’s initial access expert extradited to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A member of the notorious Ryuk ransomware operation who specialized in gaining initial access to corporate networks has been extradited to the United States. [...]

item.title: Pro-Israel hackers hit Iran's Nobitex exchange, burn $90M in crypto
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The pro-Israel "Predatory Sparrow" hacking group claims to have stolen over $90 million in cryptocurrency from Nobitex, Iran's largest crypto exchange, and burned the funds in a politically motivated cyberattack. [...]

item.title: North Korean hackers deepfake execs in Zoom call to spread Mac malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: North Korean advanced persistent threat (APT) 'BlueNoroff' (aka 'Sapphire Sleet' or 'TA444') are using deepfake company executives during fake Zoom calls to trick employees into installing custom malware on their computers. [...]

item.title: Microsoft 365 to block file access via legacy auth protocols by default
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has announced that it will soon update security defaults for all Microsoft 365 tenants to block access to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Office files via legacy authentication protocols. [...]

item.title: 'Stargazers' use fake Minecraft mods to steal player passwords
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A large-scale malware campaign specifically targets Minecraft players with malicious mods and cheats that infect Windows devices with infostealers that steal credentials, authentication tokens, and cryptocurrency wallets. [...]

item.title: ChainLink Phishing: How Trusted Domains Become Threat Vectors
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Keep Aware
item.description: Phishing has evolved—and trust is the new attack vector. ChainLink Phishing uses real platforms like Google Drive & Dropbox to sneak past filters and steal credentials in the browser. Watch Keep Aware's on-demand webinar to see how these attacks work—and how to stop them. [...]

item.title: CISA warns of attackers exploiting Linux flaw with PoC exploit
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA has warned U.S. federal agencies about attackers targeting a high-severity vulnerability in the Linux kernel's OverlayFS subsystem that allows them to gain root privileges. [...]

item.title: Healthcare SaaS firm says data breach impacts 5.4 million patients
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Episource warns of a data breach after hackers stole health information of over 5 million people in the United States in a January cyberattack. [...]

item.title: BeyondTrust warns of pre-auth RCE in Remote Support software
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: BeyondTrust has released security updates to fix a high-severity flaw in its Remote Support (RS) and Privileged Remote Access (PRA) solutions that can let unauthenticated attackers gain remote code execution on vulnerable servers. [...]
